Did this happen this evening, at about 6pm?

22) but currently we just see

 ssh: connect to host 10.137.212.204 port 22: No route to host

Thanks,

Kieran

No, the stage reboots were done on the 20th.

Are you still having the problem?


Kirsten

Kirsten

I have disabled the pushing from stage03 -> stage04 which /might/ impact

of the live site(s).

Kieran

[cid:image001.jpg@01CD34E6.2FD47E70]

Hi,
That should work now - I had to restart the server to get it pick up the
mime-type change. Can you try again and let me know please? (nb you might
be asked to re-login).
Kieran

Hi,

I was able to add the file. How can I test it if it’s working without publishing it? When I publish the audio, how will it look on the Backstage? Will I be able to add a photo to go with it?

T

Hi Tuesday, i have had a look at the Audio template... Unfortunately it doesn't look like there's any code that would actually play an audio file. Even though this was originally in the designs and also we had created the template it seems that the audio template had been dropped - not by us ( i think it was issues about which audio player to use ... ) and also because they weren't any audio files to use before and they were using videos instead?

~ Do you think you could make a video out of the audio with a static image instead?
~ Or i find a way to code it.

 I will talk to Kieran about this and get back but let me know your thoughts!

Cheers 
Lars

Thanks Lars.

I will tell the delivery partner that we can’t host audio files yet

Many thanks,

Tuesday

Hi again

Does this mean that we cannot host any mp3 files – what about making people download an mp3 file?

There is an event called All the Bells where we ask people to download a ringtone. We are still deciding whether we are going to host this on our site, so I would like to know if we can just host the audio file and make people download it from the Festival site.

Many thanks,

Tuesday

Hey Tuesday, hosting the audio file, linking and placing a download should be no problem at all! 

I wonder by when would you want this? I could probably get a small in-page player for the ring-tone going relatively quick. Its just then there's testing and all attached, so there'd be a little time needed to get this going!

Lars

Hi Lars,

We don’t need to play the ringtone – its really just for download. But for future audio files/audio player, is there a cost added to this?

Quick question – for the news template page to play audio/video, will there be any extra cost to have this feature added?

Many thanks,

Tuesday
That really is one for Jamie as i don't know about the agreements. I will ask him!
Also, shasll we get the ringtone done, have you added it to the cms and put a link on it, or can i test it. I'd quite like to make sure it works if possible.

Ticket #9722 "testing backstage" was closed and merged into this ticket. Last comment in ticket #9722:

Hey,

I think you might have confused the staging and normal server as the Url's look very similar, not sure. 

live:      http://festival.london2012.com/backstage/index.php
stage:  http://staging-festival.london2012.com/backstage/index.php

I'm happy we haven't published something by mistake, thats good, its tricky to un-publish so its better to be careful.

Lars
Summary of this ticket is pretty much how to download a ringtone. ( There will be no preview for this as far as i can see )
Summary of this ticket is pretty much how to download a ringtone and we see . ( There will be no preview for this as far as i can see )

Hey Tuesday, just as a follow up ~ regarding the ringtone upload, are there any news on this?

Cheers 
Lars

Hi Lars

Yes, we still need to test it. However what I want to do is create a news landing page and have list of the ring tones which people can download.

Let me get back to you on this later on. Was off last week so had no time to check again.

Many thanks

tuesday

Hi Lars,

I will be uploading three types of formats for the ringtone tomorrow and then send you an email. Basically I don’t want it to be in an audio template. I want to create a news landing page and then just URL links to the ringtone.

Thanks

Tuesday

Hi. You mention that uploading has 'changed'.
When did this change occur?
Thanks
Kieran
I think, when we were testing how to upload an mp3 file.

In any case, creating an image gallery has always been a pain. I always need to refresh in order to add another photo.

Tuesday

Hi Tuesday,

When you were uploading the MP3 file, did Lars or Jamie ask you to use the
simple uploader and/or to tick the "Use simple upload" box?

If so, then you should be able to revert to slicker "Flash" uploader by
simply unticking that box.

Kieran

Ok, let me try if that works.

They didn’t ask me to tick the ‘Use simple upload’, it was the default so I assumed that’s the correct one.

Kindly take a look at why I need to save-refresh-add another photo? If I don’t save and refresh, it doesn’t let me add another photo even if I click Group.

Also, a side note, the media bureau proposal, I have already sent that over to our financial manager, let me know if that’s all fine bec Jamie said he’s going to run it past you.

Thanks Kieran

Tuesday

Hi Tuesday,
I'm a little bit confused. If you say that it has /always/ been like that,
what change were you referring to when you said the following, in your
initial email:
 > Also since uploading has been changed (see screenshot),
 > I am having trouble uploading photos.
?
Kieran

Sorry for the confusion

Before it was changed to ‘simple upload’, I also had to add one photo after another (add, save, refresh). The difference is, the photos appear on the window below. After the change to ‘simple upload’ This time however, I needed to upload ALL photos first on the folder images/backstage. Then I need to create a T3 gallery, search for the photo using the picture icon meaning going thru the folders (then save, refresh, then add another photo).

In theory, it has been going on like this but now its really a longer process. I have been able to manage before because we didn’t need to create a lot of image galleries but come Festival time, I think this should be resolved.

Best,

Tuesday

Hi Tuesday,

We're seeing a scroller (see attached screenshot) what browser are you using?

Also not sure what you mean by "since uploading has been changed" we haven't changed the way images are uploaded? 

(although I notice you have "use simple image upload" checked, which may be what is causing confusion, you should be able yo uncheck this)

Secondly you can upload images/assign images in two ways:

1) Upload your images into a folder and *then* open a page and assign them.
2) Upload an image and assign an image in one step (inside the page editor)

The advantage of (1) is you can upload multiple images as a zip file and then easily assign multiple images to a page, I think this is what you want to do.

Do also un-check the "use simple upload" checkbox (unless you have this checked for a specific reason, it;s really only there for users who can't use Flash).

Jamie

Hi Wahome,

A couple of hopefully easy to answer questions, 

1) "Rename the current "Backstage" to "Gallery" - both the UI (e.g. H1 on the template) and link structure to video/photo collections"

The question here is mainly related to the way / order we do this, and just wanted to run it past you.

	a) Stop anything inside /backstage syncing to live from staging (this will mean no updated to /gallery while we do this)
	b) Move everything in the folder /backstage to a new /gallery folder (there is a question here re. broken links ie. external and internal and what we do with them, the CMS should get re-mapped (but external ones of course won't, not much we can do here and I am sure it will eventually correct itself, it's more a FYI before we do this and someone asks why the links don't work!)
	c) Rename the index page title from Backstage to Gallery (or is it Galleries?)

	b) Will these page link to"Events" or editorial pages like news or Videos/Photo like before? (prob. doesn't matter, just interested)
	c) Will these pages - that are linked to - live inside the ""Backstage" section? or elsewhere on the site (once again, prob. doesn't matter, just interested)
	d) We have assumed you want to manually link and will fill in the details+summary manually? (rather than this having any automation)
	e) We have to fixed the maximum number of cells to 20 for now? (we can increase but assume that is fine for now)

3) New "Backstage" template (Twitter feed widget)

	We have simply received an image of this (see attached). Do you want us to implement the HTML / full backend twitter integration here? what account should we use? Is there a Javascript widget from the GTW we can use?

4) New "Backstage" template (Facebook feed widget)

	Ditto above, we have simply received an image of this (see attached). Do you want us to implement the HTML / full backend twitter integration here? what account should we use? Is there a Javascript widget from the GTW we can use?

5) New "Backstage" template (Highlights from the Gallery)

	How are these assigned? do you want to assign them manually (this is what we have assumed) or should they pull automatically from the latest Video/Photo pages, or just mirror the top three items on the Gallery index page (word of warning, this may be the trickiest of all three to implement, but obv we can do it if required just may take a little longer than the other two options)

I think that's it for now

Jamie

1) "Rename the current "Backstage" to "Gallery" - both the UI (e.g. H1 on
the template) and link structure to video/photo collections"

The question here is mainly related to the way / order we do this, and just
wanted to run it past you.

a) Stop anything inside /backstage syncing to live from staging (this will
mean no updated to /gallery while we do this)

*- Holding back updates is ok - just need to coordinate with editorial
at** time
of synching*

b) Move everything in the folder /backstage to a new /gallery folder (there
is a question here re. broken links ie. external and internal and what we
do with them, the CMS should get re-mapped (but external ones of course
won't, not much we can do here and I am sure it will eventually correct
itself, it's more a FYI before we do this and someone asks why the links
don't work!)

*- Unresolved url's should simply land on new backstage.*

c) Rename the index page title from Backstage to Gallery (or is it
Galleries?)

*- Gallery (of photo/video 'collections' e.g. art gallery)*

e) We may need to republish the whole site to get urls/paths to remap from
/backstage to /gallery (not a big deal)

Is that everything or have we missed something?

*- Looks comprehensive right now.*

2) New "Backstage" template (migration + link questions)

a) This will go in the old /backstage folder (which will now be empty)
b) Will these page link to"Events" or editorial pages like news or
Videos/Photo like before? (prob. doesn't matter, just interested)

*- The links will point to whatever content editor wants to highlight - an
event, a search results page, a collection in gallery, news article, etc *

c) Will these pages - that are linked to - live inside the ""Backstage"
section? or elsewhere on the site (once again, prob. doesn't matter, just
interested)

*- The pages live wherever the story points to. NB: There is no need to
archive 'editorial highlights' - they only exist for as long as they appear
on the list of backstage stories *

d) We have assumed you want to manually link and will fill in the
details+summary manually? (rather than this having any automation)

*- Yes, all parts of each story **(image, title, short paragraph) **will be
edited manually as the main objective of new backstage is to add a more
'engaging editorial voice' to existing content on the site*

e) We have to fixed the maximum number of cells to 20 for now? (we can
increase but assume that is fine for now)

*- 20 is ok if a bit too much. Ideal number of stories recommended for
editorial is 5-7, but a bigger cap doesn't hurt (or does it?).*

3) New "Backstage" template (Twitter feed widget)

We have simply received an image of this (see attached). Do you want us to
implement the HTML / full backend twitter integration here? what account
should we use? Is there a Javascript widget from the GTW we can use?

*- Yes, the idea is for you to simply copy/paste the js widget for Twitter
Festival's twitter handle (@london2012fest) with the right look&feel. If
you prefer I can customise and send the code from Twitter (**
http://twitter.com/about/resources/widgets/widget_profile)*

4) New "Backstage" template (Facebook feed widget)

Ditto above, we have simply received an image of this (see attached). Do
you want us to implement the HTML / full backend twitter integration here?
what account should we use? Is there a Javascript widget from the GTW we
can use?

*- Same as for Twitter above*

5) New "Backstage" template (Highlights from the Gallery)

How are these assigned? do you want to assign them manually (this is what
we have assumed) or should they pull automatically from the latest
Video/Photo pages, or just mirror the top three items on the Gallery index
page (word of warning, this may be the trickiest of all three to implement,
but obv we can do it if required just may take a little longer than the
other two options)

*- These should be automated to show the topmost three collections from the
Gallery (as these are the ones the editor would have
highlighted/tagged/ordered as most important to look at in the Gallery).
Remember clicking on any of the 3 highlights in new Backstage will load
that collection in the player within the Gallery where the user can then
view more collections.*

Hi Wahome,

We've moved the sections round and put the new template it place, however we have stopped the /backstage directory updating (to live).

If you could check the new backstage page in the CMS and add any necessary content to it that would be great.

Once your happy with it (on staging) we'll remove the sync-lock and let it update to the live site.

Jamie

Jamie, still waiting on a content plan for this. Meanwhile, could you
confirm if there's any route to access either cms or staging servers
outside the ip-restricted firewall e.g. via simple password-protection? I'm
hoping that Abilitynet can review the template before it goes live and I
know they've had issues with the firewall in the past. I'd also like to
test outside the LOCOG firewall if possible. Thanks.

Jamie

Hi Liz,

We never had any concept of "French images". We did have alt text translated into French for the French site but the actual images were just the same images that appeared on the English site.

You should already have all of the images that the French site uses, as they would have been contained in zip exports.

I might be misunderstanding your question though. Are you asking for a zip file that JUST contains images that are referenced by the French site? If so then this is certainly possible but it would probably take at least a day or so (and - unless you indicate it is super-high priority) we wouldn't be able to start it until Monday.

Once you've clarified your requirement I can give you a firmer time/cost estimate.

Kind regards,

Kieran

Ah, ok. For some reason I thought that the images referenced in the French site might have been stored in a separate file/folder structure. So to clarify what you are saying is that if a static image was used on the English site, it would be the same on the French?

What I am saying is that the English page and the French translation of the English page display(ed) the same images. Meaning that all of the images that you require for the French site /should/ be in the zip files that Jamie provided you with in recent months. If any are missing though, please let me know.
Kind regards,
Kieran

description:
Hello guys,


We have a redirect rule set up for all date based media releases, so that the old urls redirect to the new ones.  However, it turns out that not all of the old urls are date based (e.g. http://www.london2012.com/press/media-releases/post-bid-2005/first-100-days.php) doesn't contain any date reference and our URL-rewrite doesn't know how to correctly handle them.  There also seems to be a 'bid-phase'.  Do you have a list of any other sub-folders or formats that our media releases used to take so we can arrange for the appropriate redirects?

Thanks!

Liz

Hi Kirsten,
Those changes look fine. Two points though:
Firstly, many of those items are very low in the technology stack and - as
such - are items that we don't really have an opinion on. (I'm thinking in
particular of the xen/virtualization tools, but also the kernel version).
Secondly, if you want us to help support this migration, we really need to
know in advance when it is going to take place. You'll recall that last
time it was performed silently, with no warning, and no notification
afterwards. If you are happy with this arrangement, then so are we but if
asked for our opinion, we would say that it would be safer for Kitsite to
be informed before and after the migration.
Kind regards,
Kieran

I’ll let you know the date after the Patching meeting tomorrow.

Thanks

Subject: INC0202210

Hello,

Lily has reported a problem whereby images aren't showing in an email.

They used to be hosted at:
http://www.london2012.com/images/games-maker/email-footer.jpg
http://www.london2012.com/images/games-maker/email-header.jpg

But of course, following the move to GTW, these links won't work anymore as the images clearly weren't move.

You can see this by going to the legacy 2012 site at:
http://gold.london2012.com/images/games-maker/email-footer.jpg
http://gold.london2012.com/images/games-maker/email-header.jpg

Do we want to put these images on GTW?  Or ask Kitsite to create an area for all images like this which need to be used in emails etc that remains public.  Gold is going to password protected soon, so we'll need to use a different URL to access them going forward.  Maybe suggest a little meeting about best technical way to progress with this.

Regards,
Kirsten

Hi Tom,

Just following up what we discussed last week and have a couple of questions and a few findings.

Findings:

- In terms of selctivly removing parts of the exiting pages (ie. ads / header / footer) we can certianly do this with a certian level or granualtity (see screen grabs attached).

- We will deal with links to pages on the existing site (that come switch over won't be accessible) by a mix of selectivly hiding or replacing headres and footers and/or rediects that will simply stop users from naviagting to links outside of a defined directory ie. /get-involved/business-network/travel-advice-for-business/

--

Questions:

Q1) Was it just the "Make your plan section/tool" or the whole "travel-advice-for-business" section
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/business-network/travel-advice-for-business/make-your-plan/index.php
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/business-network/travel-advice-for-business/

Q2) What header were you expecting to append to these pages / do you have an example of it?

Q3) Will this site be refrenced direct by a new domain / does it need it's own domain, if yes what subdomain were you expecting to use for this section. (for the toher sites ie. yourleaders.london2012.com we have setup the domains so that the redirect to the relvent folder on the current site structue ie. yourleaders.london2012.com/yourleaders if accessed direct)

Q4) Are you happy to lose the breadcrumb bar? (I assume so)

Q5) Are you happy to lose the LH local nav (for the make your plan tool this should be fine, but for a whole section it may prove slightly more complex, just need to be aware if we need to deal with it)

Q6) Would you prefer to embed the page in an iFrame (the advantage is the domain, as long as we have one we can use to access the old site, doesn't matter). The *very big* downside is this isn't such a good idea if we have multiple pages as the iFrame will need to have a single height set that covers all possiblities in terms of page length. In other words it's only realyl sensibel for fixed height content / single page content as opposed to multiple page content.

---

If you can anser the above questions, I'll get straight back with estimate / time (in fact we'll probbaly have to get started imediatly)

thanks

Jamie
subject: Keeping the travel advice 'make your plan' PDF builder [rump content]

Hi Tom,

This should be ready to link to from an iFrame now.

This is the info page iFramed (you may not need / want this page)
http://gold.london2012.com/gtw/make-your-plan/make-your-plan.php

This is the questions page iFramed (you will want to iFrame this page)
http://gold.london2012.com/gtw/make-your-plan/questions.php

This submits to this url / page (but you shouldn't need to link to it direct, instead you get there from the url above)
http://gold.london2012.com/gtw/make-your-plan/results.php?q2=No&q3=Yes

I am not sure if we should be using gold.london2012 for this purpose (have copied Kieran in for a second opinion) but unless Kieran thinks otherwise it seems like a good idea to me (need to doubel check that the public will have access to /gtw/make-your-plan/)

Jamie
K if this is ready to go can you nudge Tom to close the ticket (I expect he'll want height/width for the iFrame to give to D3, although I expect D3 can use Firebug)

Hi Tom,
This is ready to use, at http://gold.london2012.com/gtw/make-your-plan/make-your-plan.php
Can you let me know whether you need any more information and whether it's ok to close this ticket? I have added one day to the total because I had to spend a day overcoming a new restriction that had been added to requests going through Akamai since we originally coded this. Specifically the requirement that an Accept and User-Agent header have to be supplied with all requests. This might not sound like a big deal but the application we use to build the PDFs with had difficulty doing this.
Thanks,
Kieran

Hi Tom,
Are you happy for me to close this ticket?
Kieran

Hey Tuesday, the staging server system might be a little in-transparent for you guys so i think it might be best for you to not publish pages. I will normally ask send you an email and ask you if its ok to publish something so we can make sure nothing goes live by mistake.

Regarding the download issue:

Every browser seems to have a standard behavior - on yours' its to open in windows media player, others play it in the browser itself or 
open a download file dialogue.

There's a couple of options we have ( that spring to my mind ): 
1. Let people know to use the 'right-click and save as' method to download the file ( easiest ) 
2. put the ringtone in a zip file, zip files always open in the "download file" dialogue ( easiest, too)
3. open it via php using special headers, means the file stays an mp3 and on click you'll get a download file dialogue.
    ( this does sound the nicest but this also eats up the most time getting it to work / browser testing, also there is a slight chance it might not work )

I personally like the zip file approach.
Let me know.

Lars

description:
Hello

Just sending this around to all our website owners/managers to ask them to comply with the spectacularly difficult new cookies legislation :(

Please can you review this in the light of all the 'Rump' sites you are managing for us (including ODA ones), so that we have a plan to add a link?

Please liaise with Tom to agree where this link should go on each site.

Thanks!

Morag

*******

As you may be aware, on 26 May a new EU law comes into effect in the UK concerning use of cookies on websites, mobile sites and mobile apps. London 2012 needs to ensure that all its websites comply with this law, and we are therefore asking you to support these requirements through a small update to the website you manage for us.

The new law
If cookies are used in a site, the Privacy and Electronic Communications (EC Directive) (Amendment) Regulations 2011 (UK Regulations) provide that certain information must be given to that site's visitors and where possible the user must give his or her consent to the placing of the cookies. This includes all kinds of cookies, including those used for traffic analytics, advertisement, stylesheet management, user profiles and technical management.

Further information about the scope and scale of this legislation is available at the website of the Information Commissioner's Office: http://www.ico.gov.uk/for_organisations/privacy_and_electronic_communications/the_guide/cookies.aspx

How London 2012 sites must comply
It is essential that London 2012 websites comply with this law, as there will be much scrutiny given to how high-profile websites such as ours are meeting the new requirements.

London 2012's policy is to make the user aware of our use of cookies as prominently as possible, by clearly signposting users to a master 'Cookies policy' page which will be hosted on the main London 2012 website, www.london2012.com. This page will outline all the cookies featured across all London 2012 sites, and will explain how users can choose to opt out of cookies if they wish to do so.

The link to the 'Cookies policy' page should feature in the top (hygiene) or footer navigation of your site.  The URL you should use to link to will be www.london2012.com/cookies-policy - NB this page will not be active until Monday, 14 May, so you should time your navigation to be updated at that date. NB it is not sufficient to expand your 'Privacy policy' page to 'Privacy policy and cookies' - 'Cookies policy' must feature as a stand-alone link.

If it is possible also for you to include a small promotional box on the home page e.g.' How we use cookies' that would also help us deliver the requirement to signpost this information clearly. We can provide the text for this if it is possible.

What you need to do

*         Confirm to me that you can comply with our requirements in the timeframe required.

*         Plan for updating your top (hygiene) or footer navigation for 14 May.

*         Consider ability to feature a small home page promo or reference to cookies - wording to be provided by London 2012


If you have questions about how to implement this requirement, do contact me for clarification.

Many thanks in advance for your helping us comply with this legislation!

Morag Reavley
Senior New Media Manager
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
1 Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London
Direct dial: 020 32012 160
Reception: 020 32012 000

Hi Tuesday,

1/ The Olympic Journey

It's showing on the 4th page or results...
http://festival.london2012.com/events/search.php?searchString=The+Olympic+Journey&startDate=From+Date&endDate=To+Date&pageNo=4

If I search for the full title "The Olympic Journey: The Story of the Games" it appears as the 9th result on page 1
http://festival.london2012.com/events/search.php?categoryIds=&searchString=The+Olympic+Journey%3A+The+Story+of+the+Games&searchLocation=Town+or+Postcode&startDate=From+Date&endDate=To+Date&event-search-submit=Find+Events

I expect this is a side effect of us ordering the results in DATE order, over RELEVANCE order, we did highlight that this may become an issue.

The problem is that in ordering by DATE we've thrown away any RELEVANCE order, so even though the title matches exactly it's position in the results is purely down to the events date (I am not entirely sure what date GDP use to order by).

We did suggest that rather than just order the results by date, it may be more sensible to get GDP to weight the dates, ie. this week, next week, this month and add those weighting to the RELEVANCE score. That is something you'll need to discuss with GDP.

2/ Cultural Olympiad link

What's is the URL for the "filtered CO results"?

We're currently using:
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/whats-on/#f_ProgrammeName%5B%5D=Cultural+Olympiad&pageNumber=1

But it looks like the games time site is just using this url (ie. join-in is replaced with get-involved) 
http://www.london2012.com/join-in/whats-on/#f_ProgrammeName%5B%5D=Cultural+Olympiad&pageNumber=1

Can I just check the correct url before we update anything?

3/ I also notice that on Internet explorer, PNG files (with transparent background) appear with a brown background.

It's a known problem with PNG's on certain versions of IE (it's not a CMS/site issue) although fairly sure CogApp who created the HTML used a little bit of code that normally works roudn this issue. Which version of IE were you seeing the problem in? It shouldn't happen (even without the transparency workaround) in later versions (ie. 8/9)

If your not using them on a patterned background the quick fix might be to re-create without a transparent layer ie. just on a white background.

4/ "Create an artist image gallery"

I didn't see your email, but I believe the solution is to select the "group" tab in the toolbar and then add more picture cells using the + button.

Jamie

Thanks Jamie


1. I’ll flag to Wahome what’s the best solution for search

2. Kindly check the new link of CO – thanks

3. I can use a white background rather than a transparent background but they don’t look good on events pages. I will just tell the delivery partner that its an issue with Internet explorer (We are using I.E in the office)

4. Thanks for letting me know about the image gallery group tab

Tuesday

Thanks Tuesday,

> 2. Kindly check the new link of CO – thanks

I was actually asking you the question "what is the correct link" ? ;-)

> 3. I can use a white background

I think it is, but I'll ask Lars to double check the PNG transparency fix for IE is working properly (he's better than me that that sort of thing)

Hi again

Here’s the CO link
http://www.london2012.com/join-in/whats-on/#f_ProgrammeName%5B%5D=Cultural+Olympiad&f_ProgrammeName%5B%5D=Cultural+Olympiad&pageNumber=1

Tuesday
